text: Ramapati Singhania (born May 8, 1956) is an Indian industrialist. He was the director of multiple companies under the JK Group. He belongs to one of the old Indian business houses, the Singhania family. ==Early life== Ramapati Singhania was born in Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, India in a Marwari industrialist family to Gopal Krishna Singhania and Sulochana Devi. He is a grandson of Sir Padampat Singhania. He studied at the University of Virginia Darden School of Business and Carnegie Mellon University. ==Career== After the death of his father in 1980, he joined the JK Group of companies. He was the head of the PGR Group and served as a full-time Director of JK Synthetics Ltd, Director of JK Bombay Ltd, JayKay Tech Ltd, Keventor Agro Ltd, and JK Jute Mills Ltd. He was the president of the National Institute of Quality & Reliability, India. Ramapati Singhania is the author of the book "Productivity Transformation," which details his journey with JK Synthetics. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:Living people Category:Indian businesspeople
